meanings.definition: Having or showing good sense or judgment.
meanings.sent1: It is sensible to wear a helmet while riding a bike.
meanings.sent2: She made a sensible decision to save money for the future.
meanings.sent3: The sensible squirrel saved nuts for winter in a clever way.
meanings.sent4: His sensible advice was like a guiding light in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The sensible choice led to a happy outcome.

meanings.definition: Able to be perceived by the senses.
meanings.sent1: The fragrance of the flowers was very sensible.
meanings.sent2: The soft fabric felt sensible against her skin.
meanings.sent3: The sensible music soothed his ears after a long day.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted a sensible picture in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The sensible taste of the soup warmed her heart.

meanings.sent1: It is sensible to pack an umbrella when it looks like rain.
meanings.sent2: The sensible plan ensured everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The sensible cat caught the toy mouse with ease.
meanings.sent4: Her sensible approach to the problem solved it quickly.
meanings.sent5: The sensible route avoided heavy traffic.
